alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 13 at 2:19PM EDT until August 13 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Aroostook County in northern Maine... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 218 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Saint Pamphile, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Saint Pamphile, Allagash Township and Round Pond. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
